properties.areaDesc: South Lincoln County; Flaming Gorge; East Sweetwater County; Rock Springs and Green River; Upper Green River Basin
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 1:12PM MST until February 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Major Winter Storm Possible Sunday Afternoon through Monday
Night...

.A cold front will pull south into northern Wyoming Sunday
morning. This cold front will surge southward to the Continental
Divide by around sunset Sunday, and then across southwest Wyoming
Sunday night. The precipitation is expected to occur in the wake
of the cold front, and could take a few hours after frontal
passage until the snow develops. This storm system will move
slowly, with snow lingering through Monday night. The heaviest
snowfall looks to occur Sunday night and Monday morning in most
locations.

* WHAT...Heavy snow with significant blowing snow possible.
Winds could gust as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Upper Green River Basin, South Lincoln County, and
Sweetwater County.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...3 to 6 inches with locally higher amounts across
southern Lincoln and near Big Piney.

* IMPACTS...Plan on very difficult to nearly impossible travel.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecasted snow amounts will likely change
as the storm system gets closer and details become clearer.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. People
should prepare now for a drastic change to wintry and cold
conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
